author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK’s plan to significantly expand its fleet of fighter jets is poised to cost £71 billion ($96.2 billion) over the next four decades, more than triple the original estimates, according to a report by Britain’s spending watchdog.
title: UK’s F-35 Jet Program Cost Swelling to £71 Billion, Auditor Says

author: Mishal Husain
description: Malaysia’s longest-serving prime minister weighs in on US tariffs, Beijing’s tactics in the South China Sea and what it takes to stay healthy at 100.
title: Mahathir Mohamad: Trump Is ‘Against the Whole World’

author: Ruth Carson
description: Japan has emerged as a prime destination for global investors as the trade war triggers a reassessment of capital flows into the US, according to Pacific Investment Management Co.
title: Pimco Sees Japan Wooing Capital as Tariffs Spur Diversification

author: Courtney McBride
description: The State Department announced plans to lay off some US-based diplomats and other employees, after the Supreme Court ruled that the Trump administration can go ahead with plans to slash the size of the federal workforce.
title: State Department Begins Layoffs After Supreme Court Ruling

author: Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho
description: As Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and Donald Trump trade blows, the person they are fighting over has sent mixed signals to investors trying to divine who will blink first.
title: All Eyes on Bolsonaro With Lula, Trump Locked in Trade Fight

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou called on the European Central Bank to do more to support the economy as his government struggles to contain its budget deficit and address slowing growth.
title: French Premier Urges ECB to Work Toward Spurring Economic Growth

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s Senate approved a bill Thursday that would significantly increase government spending on pensions and social security, measures that threaten to derail President Javier Milei’s austerity drive before October’s midterm elections.
title: Argentina’s Congress Defies Milei’s Cuts Before Midterms

author: Edward Ludlow, Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told a room full of billionaires in Sun Valley that President Donald Trump shares a personality trait with his former boss, the famously liberal financier George Soros: they are both impatient when working on high-stakes deals.
title: Bessent Says Trump and Soros Have Something in Common: Impatience

author: Emily Flitter
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Emily Flitter, who reports on economic and social inequality, looks at what Trump’s tax and spending bill means for affordable housing. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Affordable Housing Easter Egg in Trump’s ‘Beautiful’ Bill

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: Mahmoud Khalil, the former Columbia University graduate student detained for more than three months, has filed a claim seeking $20 million in damages from the US, arguing he was wrongly imprisoned because of support for pro-Palestinian causes on campus.
title: Ex-Columbia Student Files $20 Million Claim Over ICE Detention

author: Elizabeth Rembert, Amanda Albright
description: Dartmouth College is looking to borrow more than $450 million, joining a groundswell of Ivy League issuers turning to the debt markets this year.
title: Dartmouth Joins Ivy League Bond Boom With $456 Million Debt Sale

author: Yang Yang, K Oanh Ha, Naomi Garyan Ng, Mishal Husain
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: Bloomberg’s Mishal Husain’s sit down with former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad
title: Listen: Bloomberg’s Mahathir Mohamad Interview

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Federal judges have continued to order sweeping halts to President Donald Trump’s policies in the immediate aftermath of a US Supreme Court decision that limited their use of such powers.
title: Trump Agenda Still Being Blocked by Judges Despite Supreme Court

author: Amara Omeokwe
description: A key Trump official said Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has “grossly mismanaged” the institution, demanding more information about the central bank’s renovation of its headquarters in Washington.
title: White House’s Vought Pressures Powell Over Fed Renovation

author: Josh Wingrove, Michael Shepard
description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang is meeting with US President Donald Trump at the White House on Thursday, days before a planned trip to China by the head of the world’s most valuable chipmaker, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang Meets With Trump Ahead of CEO’s China Trip

author: Michael O'Boyle
description: Every other month, Mexico’s bankers gather in a palatial bunker in the colonial center of the capital to dine together and meet with top officials.
title: Mexican Bankers Put on Brave Face in Wake of US Laundering Blitz

author: Yash Roy
description: The US Senate confirmed Jonathan Gould to lead the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, adding him to the roster of Trump administration officials who favor lighter regulation of the nation’s lenders and an embrace of crypto assets.
title: Senate Confirms Jonathan Gould as Comptroller of the Currency

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Key House lawmakers are pressing the Trump administration to accelerate a congressionally mandated review of Chinese-made drones ahead of a potential US ban of the technologies later this year.
title: GOP Lawmakers Press Trump to Speed Review of Chinese-Made Drones

author: Myles Miller
description: Six Secret Service agents have been suspended as a result of an investigation into the July 2024 assassination attempt against then-candidate Donald Trump at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Secret Service Agents Suspended Over 2024 Trump Rally Shooting

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he’s weighing the appointment of his defense chief as the country’s next ambassador to the US in a move that may trigger a government overhaul in Kyiv.
title: Zelenskiy Weighs Naming Defense Chief as US Envoy

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said the Democratic Party went too far in its focus on diversity, equity and inclusion, prioritizing ideology over practical solutions.
title: Dimon Blasts ‘Idiots’ in Democratic Party Focused on Ideology

author: Ilena Peng, Dayanne Sousa, Mariana Durao
description: President Donald Trump’s unexpected move to threaten a 50% tariff on Brazil risks roiling global commodity markets, disrupting trade on everything from beef to coffee.
title: Trump’s Brazil Tariffs Risk Upending Trade From Coffee to Beef

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Donato Paolo Mancini, Arne Delfs
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said a meeting with US and European allies in Rome stoked optimism that Donald Trump’s administration will ramp up military aid to the war-battered country, including air defense.
title: Zelenskiy Sees Movement on US Deliveries Amid Russian Assaults

author: Tarek El-Tablawy
description: Egypt left interest rates on hold, snapping two rounds of monetary easing, as caution about tensions in the region and the fallout from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs outweighed slowing inflation.
title: Egypt Halts Rate Cuts, With Caution Outranking Slower Inflation

author: Michael Nienaber, Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: Germany’s armed forces face delays to one of its biggest procurement projects, six new multipurpose combat ships.
title: German Combat Ship Order Faces Delays Over Production Problems

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: An EU-US tariff framework “needs to get done,” JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said.
title: Dimon Says an EU-US Tariff Framework ‘Needs to Get Done’

author: Patricia Xavier, Daniel Carvalho
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva pledged to retaliate with measures of his own after Donald Trump said he would impose 50% tariffs on Brazil, while his government and allies raced to seize on the threats for political gain.
title: Brazil Politics: Lula Races to Capitalize on Trump Tariff Threat

author: Lucy White, Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer reached a “one in, one out” migrant returns trial with French President Emmanuel Macron as they attempt to slash the number of people crossing the English Channel on dangerous small boats.
title: UK and France Seal ‘One In, One Out’ Deal on Migrant Returns

author: Aaron Eglitis
description: Latvian Prime Minister Evika Silina signaled that Ukraine will receive a delivery of the US-made Patriot air defense systems as the country comes under increasingly relentless Russian drone and missile strikes.
title: Latvia’s Premier Signals Ukraine Will Get New Patriot Batteries

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump’s executive order limiting automatic birthright citizenship was put on hold again by a federal judge in a revised class-action lawsuit, reinstating a nationwide block that was paused last month by the US Supreme Court.
title: Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Limits Are Blocked Again by Judge

author: Loren Grush
description: Senators from both parties signaled they plan to push back against the Trump administration’s proposed cuts to NASA and its science programs, setting up a potential budget battle with the White House.
title: Senators Signal They’re Prepared to Push Back Against NASA Cuts

author: Emily Flitter
description: A set of provisions tucked into President Donald Trump’s new tax-and-spending law has real estate developers and affordable housing proponents cheering – though some view it as a bittersweet victory.
title: Trump Tax Law Is Surprise Boon for Affordable Housing Creation

author: Colum Murphy, Eric Martin
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he’s working on setting up a meeting with his Chinese counterpart at a summit in Malaysia this week, the first in-person session between the two and a possible prelude to a presidential summit.
title: Rubio Working on First In-Person Meeting With China Counterpart

author: Catherine Cartier
description: US regulatory actions to ensure oil and gas pipeline safety have plummeted to a record low for the start of a presidential administration as Donald Trump pushes to streamline the government and cut red tape.
title: Oil and Gas Pipeline Safety Cases Plunge in First Months of Trump’s Second Term

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams slammed the state’s former governor Andrew Cuomo for blowing the Democratic primary race, running as an independent and potentially splitting the vote against Zohran Mamdani.
title: NYC Mayor Adams Blasts Cuomo for Dividing Anti-Mamdani Vote

author: Bob Van Voris
description: Argentina filed notice that it was appealing a US judge’s ruling requiring the South American nation to hand over its controlling stake in energy company YPF SA by next week to help satisfy a $16 billion judgment.
title: Argentina Moves to Appeal US Judge’s Order to Give Up YPF Stake

author: Indy Scholtens
description: An ex-ASML Holding NV employee was sentenced to three years in Dutch prison for sharing confidential information from several chip manufacturing companies with Russia.
title: Ex-ASML Staffer Gets 3 Years in Jail for Sharing Trade Secrets with Russia

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Jonathan Ferro, Annmarie Hordern, Lisa Abramowicz
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence said Donald Trump had the right to publicly share his views about Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and decision-making on interest rates — and that he had his own concerns about the central bank’s policies.
title: Pence Says Trump Has Right to Share Views on Powell, Fed Policy

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said any US deliveries of Patriot air-defense systems to Ukraine remained open a week after he lobbied President Donald Trump to dispatch the hardware.
title: Merz Says US Delivery of Patriot Systems to Kyiv Undecided

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz, Annmarie Hordern
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence criticized Donald Trump’s tariff agenda, saying it was a starkly different approach to trade from his first term that would harm American consumers and businesses.
title: Pence Assails Trump for Shifting to ‘Permanent’ Tariff Barriers

author: Joao Lima
description: Portugal plans to sell a 49.9% stake in TAP SA, its latest attempt to privatize Europe’s largest wholly state-owned airline.
title: Portugal Kicks Off Plan to Sell 49.9% Stake in Carrier TAP

author: Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil spent months flying under the radar as Donald Trump upended global trade. Now that it’s in the spotlight, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva may stand to benefit from the attention.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Gift Lula Surprise Tailwind for 2026 Vote

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: The highest-ranking military officer of the US visited Seoul for talks with his South Korean and Japanese counterparts as President Donald Trump ratchets up pressure on his Asian allies over defense spending and trade.
title: Top US General Meets Counterpart in Seoul Amid Budget Pressure

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuanian leaders were taken to a shelter after a false alarm about a combat drone entering the Baltic nation’s airspace from neighboring Belarus.
title: Lithuanian Leaders Evacuated Amid Combat-Drone False Alarm

author: Alastair Gale
description: Japan’s foreign minister urged his Chinese counterpart to ensure Japanese companies have access to rare earths and expressed concern about Chinese military activity close to Japan.
title: Japan Urges China to Ensure Access to Rare Earths, Magnets

author: Lucille Liu
description: China accused the US of using long-arm jurisdiction to detain an alleged Chinese hacker in Italy, in a dispute that threatens to turn into another point of friction in bilateral ties.
title: China Slams US ‘Long Arm’ in Arrest of Alleged Hacker in Italy

author: Lyubov Pronina
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen survived a no-confidence vote over text messages she sent to Pfizer Inc. Chief Executive Officer Albert Bourla during the Covid pandemic.
title: EU’s Von Der Leyen Wins Confidence Vote Over Pfizer Texts

author: Paul Vecchiatto, Antony Sguazzin
description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance, the second-biggest party in the coalition government, laid criminal charges against the nation’s police minister, who’s been accused of interfering in an investigation into political assassinations.
title: South Africa’s DA Lays Criminal Charges Against Police Minister

author: Julia Leite
description: As Trump hits Brazil with 50% tariffs, it’s unclear what Lula could offer even if he were to negotiate.
title: Lula, Trump Clash as US Tariffs Turn Political

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The threat posed by Iran to dissidents living in the UK has significantly increased in recent years, according to an influential panel of lawmakers who urged the British government to bolster cyber resilience and espionage capacity.
title: Iran Threat to Dissidents in UK Has Jumped, Lawmaker Panel Says

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations program overseeing the fight against AIDS urged countries to step up with support to fight the disease as the Trump administration pulls back, and warned that a permanent halt in funding by the US would undo years of progress.
title: UNAIDS Calls for Nations to Fill the Gap as Trump Pulls Funding

author: Derek Decloet, Philip Heijmans
description: Canada’s top diplomat said she aims to finalize a free trade agreement with Southeast Asian nations “as soon as possible,” as the country looks to expand economic ties in the face of tariffs from President Donald Trump.
title: Canada Seeks Southeast Asia Trade Deal to Blunt Trump Tariffs

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: The Netherlands has allocated €300 million ($352 million) to support the reconstruction of Ukraine in 2025 and 2026, the Dutch foreign minister said during the Ukraine Recovery Conference in Rome Thursday.
title: Dutch Pledge €300 million to Help Rebuild Ukraine in 2025, 2026

author: Bill Faries, Audrey Wan
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to serve as US ambassador to Singapore had a contentious Senate confirmation hearing in which he struggled to answer inquiries about the city-state and its ties to Washington.
title: Trump’s Pick for Singapore Envoy Has Rough Confirmation Hearing

author: Toru Fujioka
description: A report on the Bank of Japan’s branch managers’ meeting offered little clarity over the impact of President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, underscoring the central bank’s wait-and-see mode before considering another interest rate hike.
title: BOJ’s Branch Manager Report Indicates Wait-And-See Mode on Rates

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: An Indian trade delegation is likely to visit Washington in the coming days for further talks on a trade deal, according to an official familiar with the matter.
title: India Team Likely to Visit US Soon to Advance Trade Talks

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: Singapore’s tariff talks with the US will include a focus on pharmaceutical supply chains as the trade-reliant nation navigates President Donald Trump’s global trade war.
title: Singapore to Discuss Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Issues With US

author: Nayla Razzouk, Milda Seputyte, Sanne Wass
description: Countries are struggling to rebuild their professional armies despite the threat of a resurgent Russia.
title: Marketer, Student, Veteran: The Part-Time Soldiers Signing Up to Defend Europe

author: Upmanyu Trivedi, Lucca De Paoli
description: Review of the criminal justice system would limit jury trials in complex financial cases and lower level offenses. Critics label it cut-price justice.
title: Leveson Puts UK Jury Trials on Notice With Proposed Justice Shake-Up

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Canada should become a world leader in producing and processing raw materials for military equipment and defense systems, according to an influential business group.
title: Top CEOs Want Canada to Build a Strategic Minerals Reserve for Defense

author: Matthew Brooker
description: Enrollments are falling in the UK after Labour put VAT on fees. It's too early to call the policy a failure, let alone a class war.
title: Private School Tax Breaks Aren't a Human Right

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Arne Delfs
description: Ukrainian allies gathering in Rome to discuss the nation’s postwar revival will be forced to grapple with the reality that such a prospect is looking more remote than ever.
title: Ukraine Recovery Meeting Shows War’s End Is Ever More Distant

author: Josh Xiao
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi called on Southeast Asian nations to uphold openness and cooperation Thursday, delivering a message of inclusivity as President Donald Trump threatens sweeping tariffs on nations across the region.
title: China Calls on Southeast Asia to Back Openness as US Levies Loom

author: Eddie Spence
description: Indonesia aims to transition entirely to renewable energy by the middle of the coming decade, according to President Prabowo Subianto, well ahead of the country’s previously announced goal.
title: Prabowo Says Indonesia Can Hit 100% Renewable Energy by 2035

author: Joy Lee
description: Malaysia’s Attorney General Chambers has confirmed for the first time the existence of a document that former premier Najib Razak says would allow him to serve the rest of his jail term for corruption under house arrest, local media reported.
title: Malaysia Confirms Existence of Order Key to Najib’s House Arrest

author: Loren Grush
description: President Donald Trump named Secretary of Transport Sean Duffy as what he calls an interim administrator of NASA, replacing current acting administrator Janet Petro.
title: Trump Names Sean Duffy Interim Administrator of NASA

author: Toru Fujioka
description: Japan’s automakers slashed the price of products exported to the US at a record pace, in a sign that companies are sacrificing profits to remain competitive as President Donald Trump’s tariffs hit cars.
title: Japan’s Carmakers Slash Export Prices to US to Offset Tariff Hit

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s total beef exports to the US rose significantly in June in the face of President Donald Trump’s new tariff regime, which saw the American leader specifically single out Canberra for refusing to accept adequate red meat imports.
title: Australia’s Beef Exports to the US Surge Despite Trump Tariffs

author: Joe Deaux, Martin Ritchie
description: President Donald Trump said the US would begin levying a 50% tariff on copper imports from Aug. 1, confirming a move that will hurt American producers of everything from automobiles to appliances.
title: Trump Says 50% Tariff on Copper Imports to Take Effect August 1

author: Heesu Lee
description: The Bank of Korea left its policy rate unchanged Thursday as it monitors the impact of its earlier easing moves on soaring home prices and an economy threatened by higher US tariffs.
title: BOK Stands Pat on Rate as Housing Rally, Tariffs Take Focus

author: Eric Martin, Jon Herskovitz
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio is scheduled to meet his Russian counterpart Thursday as the US prepares to send more weapons to Ukraine to help it fend off attacks from the Kremlin’s war machine.
title: Rubio to Meet Lavrov While US Sends More Weapons to Ukraine

author: Hideyuki Sano, Bailey Lipschultz
description: China’s technology giants are set to shrug off the impact of higher US tariffs as their outlook is now far more dependent on local consumer sentiment, according to Baillie Gifford & Co.
title: Baillie Gifford Says Consumer Key for China Techs, Not Tariffs

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: A South Korean court issued a warrant to arrest former President Yoon Suk Yeol, putting him back in detention four months after he was released over his botched attempt to put the country under martial law.
title: South Korea’s Ex-President Yoon Arrested in Martial Law Probe

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: The US government said Wednesday it has located a man wrongly deported to El Salvador and whose whereabouts were previously unknown, adding that he is being held in the country’s CECOT maximum-security prison.
title: Man Wrongly Deported by US Has Been Found in El Salvador Prison
